Comment: Jointly with the Committee on Criminal Justice

Items.Title: Jointly with the Committee on Criminal Justice

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of social services and the department of homeless services to provide drug treatment services
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring the dept of social services and the dept of homeless services to provide drug treatment services.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to amending the bill of rights for incarcerated individuals and establishing guiding principles for the design of newly constructed jails
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.MatterName: Amending the bill of rights for incarcerated individuals and establishing guiding principles for the design of newly constructed jails.

Items.Title: A Local Law to require the board of correction to report on the impact on incarcerated individuals of closing jails on Rikers Island, and to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the mayor’s office of criminal justice to report on progress in closing jails on Rikers Island
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.MatterName: Require the BOC to report on the impact on incarcerated individuals of closing jails on Rikers Island, and requiring the mayor’s office of criminal justice to report on progress in closing jails on Rikers Island.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to the establishment of a commission to make recommendations on reinvestment in communities impacted by Rikers Island
Items.ActionName: Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing on P-C Item by Comm
Items.MatterName: Establishment of a commission to make recommendations on reinvestment in communities impacted by Rikers Island.

Items.MinutesNote: Other Council Members Attending: Holden, Ampry-Samuel, Lancman, Powers, Levine, Ayala and Rivera.
